{
    "topic": "Puzzles/Seating Arrangements (Linear)",
    "question": "Five friends, Alice, Bob, Carol, Dave, and Eve, are sitting in a row. Alice sits next to Bob but not next to Carol. Dave does not sit at either end. Who can sit next to Carol?",
    "choices": [
        "A) Alice",
        "B) Bob",
        "C) Dave",
        "D) Eve"
    ],
    "answer": "D",
    "explanation": "Alice cannot sit next to Carol because she sits next to Bob but not Carol. Bob also cannot sit next to Carol for the same reason. Dave cannot sit next to Carol as he does not sit at either end and needs to be surrounded by others. Therefore, Eve can sit next to Carol."
}

{
    "topic": "Logical Reasoning/Syllogisms",
    "question": "All cats are animals. Some animals are not dogs. Which of the following conclusions can be drawn?",
    "choices": [
        "A) Some cats are not dogs.",
        "B) No cats are dogs.",
        "C) Some animals are cats.",
        "D) All animals are cats."
    ],
    "answer": "C",
    "explanation": "The statement 'All cats are animals' means that every cat falls under the category of animals, but it does not imply anything specific about their relationship with dogs. The statement 'Some animals are not dogs' is true for all animals except dogs, including some cats. However, we cannot conclude that some cats are not dogs because the original statements do not provide enough information to make this deduction. Therefore, the only valid conclusion is that 'Some animals are cats.'"
}

{
    "topic": "Blood Relations and Family Tree",
    "question": "In a family, A is the brother of B. B is the daughter of C. D is the son of C. E is the wife of D. What is the relationship between A and E?",
    "choices": [
        "A) Brother-in-law",
        "B) Sister-in-law",
        "C) Cousin",
        "D) Aunt"
    ],
    "answer": "A",
    "explanation": "A is the brother of B, who is the daughter of C. D is the son of C and hence, the brother of B. E is the wife of D. Therefore, A is the brother-in-law of E."
}

{
    "topic": "Blood Relations and Family Tree",
    "question": "In a family, A is the son of B. B is the daughter of C. C is the wife of D. E is the brother of D. Who is the uncle of A?",
    "choices": [
        "A) B",
        "B) C",
        "C) D",
        "D) E"
    ],
    "answer": "D",
    "explanation": "E is the brother of D, who is married to C. Since B is the daughter of C and the mother of A, E is the uncle of A as he is the sibling of A's parent."
}

{
    "topic": "Logical Reasoning/Syllogisms",
    "question": "All cats are animals. No dogs are cats. Which of the following statements must be true?",
    "choices": [
        "A) Some animals are not dogs.",
        "B) All animals are dogs.",
        "C) No animals are dogs.",
        "D) Some dogs are animals."
    ],
    "answer": "A",
    "explanation": "The statement 'All cats are animals' implies that the category of cats is a subset of animals. The statement 'No dogs are cats' means there is no overlap between dogs and cats. Therefore, it does not imply anything about whether some animals are not dogs, but it does confirm that not all animals can be dogs since some animals (cats) are excluded from being dogs. Hence, option A is the only statement that must be true."
}

{
    "topic": "Blood Relations and Family Tree",
    "question": "In a family, P is the brother of Q, who is the daughter of R. S is the son of T, and T is the sister of R. How is P related to S?",
    "choices": [
        "A) Brother",
        "B) Cousin",
        "C) Uncle",
        "D) Nephew"
    ],
    "answer": "C",
    "explanation": "P is the brother of Q, who is the daughter of R. Since T is the sister of R, T's children (including S) would make P their uncle."
}

{
    "topic": "Blood Relations and Family Tree",
    "question": "In a family, X is the brother of Y. Z is the sister of Y and the wife of W. How is W related to X?",
    "choices": [
        "A) Brother-in-law",
        "B) Uncle",
        "C) Cousin",
        "D) Father"
    ],
    "answer": "A",
    "explanation": "W is the husband of Z, who is the sister of Y and thus the sibling of X's sibling. Therefore, W is X's brother-in-law."
}

{
    "topic": "Blood Relations and Family Tree",
    "question": "In a family, A is the son of B. B is the daughter of C. C is the wife of D. E is the brother of D. Who is the uncle of A?",
    "choices": [
        "A) B",
        "B) C",
        "C) D",
        "D) E"
    ],
    "answer": "D",
    "explanation": "E is the brother of D, who is the father of B (since B is the daughter of C and C is the wife of D). Therefore, E is the uncle of A, as A is the son of B."
}

{
    "topic": "Blood Relations and Family Tree",
    "question": "In a family, John has two brothers, Mike and David. Mike is married to Sarah, who has a sister named Lisa. David is not married but has a cousin named Alex. If Alex's father is John's uncle, how is Alex related to Mike?",
    "choices": [
        "A) Nephew/Niece",
        "B) Cousin",
        "C) Brother/Sister",
        "D) Son/Daughter"
    ],
    "answer": "B",
    "explanation": "Alex is John’s cousin because his father is John’s uncle. Since Mike is John’s brother, Alex would also be Mike’s cousin."
}

{
    "topic": "Puzzles/Seating Arrangements (Circular)",
    "question": "Eight friends A, B, C, D, E, F, G, and H are sitting around a circular table facing the center. A is third to the right of C who is second to the left of F. D is not an immediate neighbor of either A or C. E is second to the right of G. Who is sitting immediately to the right of H?",
    "choices": [
        "A) A",
        "B) B",
        "C) F",
        "D) G"
    ],
    "answer": "C",
    "explanation": "From the given information, we can deduce the seating arrangement as follows: Starting with C, who is second to the left of F, then A being third to the right of C places A between F and G. Since D is not an immediate neighbor of A or C, D must sit next to H. Given E is second to the right of G, this fixes E's position. The remaining positions fill in B and H, with H being to the immediate left of F, making F sit immediately to the right of H."
}

{
    "topic": "Logical Reasoning/Syllogisms",
    "question": "All cats are mammals. Some pets are cats. Which of the following statements can be logically concluded from the given premises?",
    "choices": [
        "A) All pets are mammals.",
        "B) Some mammals are pets.",
        "C) Some pets are not mammals.",
        "D) All mammals are pets."
    ],
    "answer": "B",
    "explanation": "From the premises 'All cats are mammals' and 'Some pets are cats', we can deduce that some pets, being cats, are also mammals. This means 'Some mammals are pets' is a valid conclusion. However, we cannot conclude that all pets are mammals, as there may be pets that are not cats (and hence not necessarily mammals). We also cannot conclude that some pets are not mammals since the given information does not provide enough context to make this statement true."
}

        "B) Niece",
        "C) Cousin",
        "D) Daughter"
    ],
    "answer": "B",
    "explanation": "T is the sister of S, who is the son of P. Since P is the brother of Q, and Q is married to R, T is the daughter of Q and hence R's niece."
}

{
    "topic": "Logical Reasoning/Syllogisms",
    "question": "All cats are mammals. Some pets are cats. Which of the following statements must be true?",
    "choices": [
        "A) All pets are mammals.",
        "B) Some pets are not mammals.",
        "C) Some mammals are not pets.",
        "D) All mammals are pets."
    ],
    "answer": "C",
    "explanation": "Since all cats are mammals and some pets are cats, it follows that some pets are mammals. However, we cannot conclude that all pets are mammals because there may be pets that are not cats (e.g., dogs). Similarly, we cannot conclude that all mammals are pets since not all mammals are necessarily pets. Thus, option C is the only statement that must be true based on the given information."
}

{
    "topic": "Logical Reasoning/Syllogisms",
    "question": "All cats are mammals. Some pets are cats. Which of the following conclusions can be drawn?",
    "choices": [
        "A) All pets are mammals.",
        "B) Some pets are not mammals.",
        "C) All mammals are pets.",
        "D) Some mammals are not pets."
    ],
    "answer": "A",
    "explanation": "The statement 'All cats are mammals' means every cat falls under the category of mammals. The second statement 'Some pets are cats' implies there exists at least some overlap between pets and cats. However, this does not imply that all pets are mammals, nor does it suggest anything about other mammals or non-cat pets being mammals or not being pets."
}
